subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] [Fwd: Ever-circular - traveling handwritten letters]
msgSnippet: ... Quite. There is no reason to wrap a bitmap image in a PDF. But wouldn t PNG or GIF be the best image format? JPEG is optimised for color photos and creates
messageBody:
On 2007-09-22 Benjamin Bruce wrote:
> Those who don't have the software to make PDF's (or
> those who don't want to bother figuring out how) could
> just save their scans as JPEG, as long as they weren't
> too gigantic. In this case, a PDF would practically
> serve as another picture format, since it will be
> handwritten text. My suggestion would be to make a
> separate e-mail group for those who want to participate,
> so we wouldn't have to keep track of everyone who's on
> the list. Sign me up, by the way--if anyone needs
> practice reading Quickscript, it's me!
>

Quite. There is no reason to wrap a bitmap image in a PDF.
But wouldn't PNG or GIF be the best image format? JPEG is
optimised for color photos and creates 'noise' -- basically
digital smudge -- in large monochrome areas such as you will
typically find in sanned texts and drawings.

: /|
: _| |
: \|

/BP -- whose handwriting is atrocious in any script
